result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas F Prisk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas F Prisk

defendant.name: Prisk, Thomas F
defendant.address: N2450 Wenham Rd, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.addlTxt: From DOC advising Defendant paid in full
Probation review hearing on April 13, 2018 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:35pm [mo]
Defendant Thomas F Prisk in court with attorney Michael C. Witt.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Witt indicates ready to proceed to plea/sentencing 
The Court and Counsel discuss the submission of an amended complaint.

Atty. Witt waives the right to be presented with a written amended criminal complaint
The Court allows the state to allow the criminal complaint to be amended to the language within the CCS, with the understanding that the fact portion in identical

  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Amended Counts #1 and #2 and added Count #3 as layed out in the Criminal Case Settlement; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
---ADA Shock submits victim impact statement 

The Court finds that the amount restitution is stipulated to in the amount of $2620, and that Mr. Prisk has an ability to pay the amount 

On Amended Counts #1 and #2 and added Count #3 as layed out in the Criminal Case Settlement, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions at set forth in the Criminal Case Settlement.

[which are: 
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per agent
--absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances without valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--anger management or other program at agent's discretion 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no contact with Jameson Altreuter and Cody Edwards- except for writing of letter of apology to be given to them through the probation agent
--to pay statutory costs
--to pay restitution in the amount of $2,620 to Cody Edwards ]

The Court does not order DNA sample 

Days credit for time already served:  1  days
In the Court's view contact is NOT appearing at a civil hearing or attending a mediation as required by Court where Mr. Altreuter or Mr. Edwards is also required to be present. 
recess: 4:10pm
Preliminary hearing on May 10, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Case called at 11:58am [mo]
Defendant Thomas F Prisk in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 11:59am

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing(likely waiver) on 6/30/16 at 3:30pm
Defendant's response to State's demand for discovery
Defense's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 1:20pm [mo]
Defendant Thomas F Prisk appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann(Bond Purposes Only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Hagemann indicates that SPD is representing for bond purposes only; the Court gives right to Counsel
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Defendant confirms DOB and address on Complaint
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--No Contact with Jameson Altreuter, Cody Edwards, Brianna Roraff or Michael Stachowiak
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
recess 1:23  pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/2/16 at 10:00am   (2) Status Conference on 4/19/16 at 10:00am
